intro: Pentaraphia corrugata, commonly known as the roughleaf pittosporum, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Pittosporaceae and is characterized by its rough, bark-like leaves and fragrant white flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are dark green and have a distinctive corrugated texture, while its flowers are borne in clusters and bloom in spring. Pentaraphia corrugata is often found in coastal and lowland forest habitats.
